conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine the direction of motion.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of the particle over time. Positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction, and negative velocity indicates motion in the negative direction.
Identify the time interval of interest: from 2 to 3 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 0 (crossing the time axis).
From 2 to 3 seconds, the velocity decreases and becomes negative.
Since the velocity is negative from 2 to 3 seconds, the particle is moving in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.
